title.narrative: HEALTH SECTOR SUPPORT

description.narrative: An enabling policy and institutional environment is enhanced for effective scaling up and implementation of Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) services by 2016, which contributes to Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Early Childhood Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most vulnerable children and women access a minimum social protection package

participating-org.narrative: STATE MINISTRY OF SOCIAL DEVELOPMEN CULTURE YOUTH AND SPORT

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)

National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: An enabling policy and institutional environment is enhanced for effective scaling up and implementation of MNCH services by 2016

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, MoH has finalized the IMNCI guidelines including new-born care and associated job aids. Support had been also provided to develop the Boma Health Initiative policy that sets up a strategy to roll out all basic health services at the community level. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2015

title.narrative: No. of health facilities in underserved focused counties in the affected states following crisis rebuilt and rehabilitated by 2016.

actual.value: 2015:0 - ToRs and BoQ submitted for 3 PHCCs (Aweil North, Yirol East and Awerial)

title.narrative: of underserved focused counties across the country with fully functional HMIS by 2016

actual.value: 2015:10 (have DHIS functional, though not that efficient)

title.narrative: No. of counties implementing MoRES Level 3 monitoring on MNCH programming by 2016

actual.value: 2015:M&E activities not up to MoRES Standard. Essentially MoRES has not been implemented so far

title.narrative: No. of costed Health, Nutrition and HIV/AIDS Policies, Strategies and Plans developed by 2016

actual.value: 2015:HIV policy, HIV strategic plan, PMTCT scale UP plan and HIV prevention strategy costed. IYCF and IMCI guidelines in draft 5

title.narrative: No. of counties with County Health Operational Plan including M&E framework and budget by 2016

actual.value: 2015:14 (11 by Health Pooled Fund and IMA)
